meanings.definition: To provide new or updated information to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She reinformed her friend about the change in plans.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reinformed the students about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The cat reinformed the dog about the new house rules.
meanings.sent4: The sun reinformed the flowers with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock reinformed her of the early morning meeting.

meanings.sent1: He reinformed himself on the safety procedures before starting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The coach reinformed the players on the game strategy during halftime.
meanings.sent3: The robot reinformed the scientist on how to operate it.
meanings.sent4: The book reinformed her mind with valuable knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The museum tour reinformed the visitors about the history of the artifacts.

meanings.definition: To give new knowledge or understanding to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The documentary reinformed the viewers about the impact of climate change.
meanings.sent2: The workshop reinformed the participants on the latest research findings.
meanings.sent3: The magician reinformed the audience with a new trick.
meanings.sent4: The mentor reinformed her mentee with valuable life lessons.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit reinformed visitors about ancient civilizations.
